Instruction: Wash the radishes and trim off the tops and roots. Thinly slice the radishes.
In a small saucepan, combine white vinegar, water, sugar, salt, and black peppercorns. Bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar and salt are dissolved.
Place the sliced radishes in a clean glass jar.
Pour the hot vinegar mixture over the radishes, making sure they are completely submerged.
Let the pickled radishes cool to room temperature, then cover the jar and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
Serve the pickled radishes as a tangy and crunchy side dish.
